data.title: Rhapsody In Blue – a timeless American classic
data.description: On Feb 12, 1924, a concert organised by popular jazz band leader Paul Whiteman was held at the Aeolian Hall in New York City. Despite the cold and snow, the show was jam-packed not only with music fans but also composers like Sergei Rachmaninov and John Philip Souza and popular actors like Gertrude Lawrence.

data.title: Colombian-French artist David Rodriguez brings cultural fusion to Bangkok
data.description: The beauty of cultural fusion is portrayed through art during "Bailemos", which is running at the Art Exhibition Space, 5th floor of Siam Discovery, Rama I Road, until Sunday.

data.title: Unicef marks Children's Day with a new campaign
data.description: To mark World Children

data.title: Follow Jungkook's journey in new documentary
data.description: As Korean heartthrob Jungkook is serving in the military, Disney+ Hotstar will premiere a new three-part docuseries titled The Original on Dec 3, allowing fans to follow his growth from being a member of BTS to becoming an acclaimed solo artist.

data.title: A gathering of ghosts
data.description: Among Thai ghosts, the top three legends -- Mae Nak, Phee Pob and Phee Krasue -- have frequently featured in films and television series. According to Creative Economy Agency (CEA), Mae Nak has appeared in over 40 films and TV series while Phee Pob has made over 30 appearances in films and TV series.

data.title: Tech start-ups get extra funds
data.description: The Higher Education, Science, Research and Innovation Ministry announced an increase of almost 20% of its technology fund for 270 projects to support tech entrepreneurs expand their start-up ventures for next year.

data.title: Joint panel to thrash out  differences on referendum
data.description: Disagreements surrounding the referendum bill may be settled as early as tomorrow, with opposing parties set to strike a deal on a "one and a half" majority rule as an alternative to the double majority requirement to pass a referendum.

data.title: War 'no obstacle' to ramping up relations
data.description: The war between  Ukraine  and  Russia  officially enters its 1,000th day on Tuesday, but despite the ongoing conflict, Kyiv remains committed to strengthening ties with countries in Southeast Asia to create new partnerships for mutual growth and secure additional assistance to end the war and get justice for its citizens.

data.title: PM urged to return land to monastery
data.description: Former senator Somchai Sawangkarn sent a third open letter to Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, urging her to expedite the return of a monastic plot of land acquired by Alpine Golf Course to Wat Thamikararam Worawihan, saying that the head of the government must perform her duties with honesty for the benefit of the country.

data.title: Key panel appointment for negotiation with Cambodia may face delay
data.description: The planned appointment of the Joint Technical Committee (JTC) to negotiate with  Cambodia  on the development of  disputed maritime areas  in the  Gulf of Thailand  might not be tabled for the cabinet

data.title: New booze control bill nearly ready
data.description: The chairman of the special committee scrutinising new alcohol control legislation, Wisarn Techathirawat, said the draft of the  Alcoholic Beverage Control  Bill was about 80% complete and would be submitted to parliament in mid-December.

data.title: Stimulus plan in the works
data.description: The Finance Ministry will on Tuesday present a comprehensive economic stimulus package to a related committee chaired by Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra for consideration, said Deputy Finance Minister Julapun Amornvivat.

data.title: Ishii says Thai team need improvement
data.description: Thailand were held to a second draw in as many matches when Laos secured a 1-1 tie at Thammasat Stadium on Sunday night, but War Elephants coach Masatada Ishii said he will be keeping faith with the same squad for the next month

data.title: What Russia's invasion has cost Ukraine as war reaches 1000th day
data.description: KYIV - Russia

data.title: ONE Championship: Jacob Smith insists Rodtang elbow ‘changed the fight’, vows to return for title
data.description: Jacob Smith vowed to return for the ONE Championship flyweight Muay Thai title after admitting an elbow from Rodtang Jitmuangnon “changed the fight”.

data.title: Famous Thai voiceover team to wrap up its iconic career next year
data.description: Phantamit, known for dubbing big-screen hits like “The Storm Riders” and “Shaolin Soccer”, set to wrap up its 30-plus years in the Thai entertainment industry during Songkran

data.title: Inquiry into Thailand's rising dugong death toll expanded
data.description: Another  dugong  was found dead in Krabi on Sunday as the Natural Resources and Environment Minister Chalermchai Sri-on directed relevant authorities to expedite urgent measures concerning the  alarming increase  in the dugong death rate.

data.title: Thailand to return rare animals to Madagascar
data.description: Thailand will return over 900  lemurs  and rare  turtles  seized from the illegal wildlife trade to  Madagascar  this month, according to the Department of National Parks, Wildlife and Plant Conservation (DNP).

data.title: Singer quits Palang Pracharath Party amid extortion probe
data.description: Singer Rattapoom “Film” Tokongsup has resigned from the opposition Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) amid a probe into alleged  extortion  related to  The iCon Group  case.

data.title: Inquiry into increasing dugong death expanded
data.description: Another dugong was found dead in Krabi on Sunday as the Natural Resources and Environment Minister Chalermchai Sri-on directed relevant authorities to expedite urgent measures concerning the alarming increase in the dugong death rate.
